articles.title: Smoke-dried human remains found in Asia may be world's oldest known mummies, researchers say - CBS News
articles.description: Some ancient societies in Asia appear to have smoke-dried their dead, effectively mummifying them thousands of years earlier than their Egyptian counterparts, new research has found.
articles.content:
Scientists have discovered what's thought to be the oldest known mummies in the world in southeastern Asia dating back up to 12,000 years.
Mummification prevents decay by preserving dead bodies. The… [+3147 chars]
